message.content:
cs.DM, cs.FL, cs.LO, cs.SY, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the synchronizability problem in automata with transitions weighted in an arbitrary semiring, which is a topic in discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The concept of synchronizability is also relevant to formal languages (cs.FL) and logic (cs.LO). The paper introduces a new notion of location-synchronizing matrices, which is related to control theory and system dynamics (cs.SY). Finally, the paper discusses the computational complexity of the synchronizability problem, which is a topic in computational complexity theory (cs.CC).
